00044 #define CACHE_PURGE_TRIGGER 60     // cache entry purge, in seconds
00045 #define CACHE_CLEAN_BATCH 16       // seconds between cleaning batches
00046 #define CACHE_CLEAN_DELTA 8        // cache clean batch size
00047 #define ADVISE_NEED_RESET 1        // reset value for adviseNeed
00048 #define UPDATE_STALL_DELTA 15      // seconds used to determine stalled update
00049 #define UPDATE_NEED_DELTA 6        // seconds for adaptive update
00050 #define SHORT_DELAY_MICROS 500    // short delay for quick reschedule
00051 #define COMPARE_ASSUME_BAD 20      // secs since last fetch OK to assume compare failed
00052 #define NODE_SPLIT_TRIGGER 400    // in bytes, triggers node split
00053 #define EXCLUSION_LIMIT 1000       // in bytes, limits exclusion list size
00054 #define EXCLUSION_TRIG 5           // trigger for including root hashes in excl list (secs)
00055 #define STABLE_TIME_TRIG 10        // trigger for storing stable point (secs)
00056 #define HASH_SPLIT_TRIGGER 17      // trigger for splitting based on hash (n/255)
00057 #define NAMES_YIELD_INC 100        // number of names to inc between yield tests
00058 #define NAMES_YIELD_MICROS 20*1000 // number of micros to use as yield trigger

00060 struct ccns_slice {
00061     unsigned version;
00062     unsigned nclauses;
00063     struct ccn_charbuf *topo;
00064     struct ccn_charbuf *prefix;
00065     struct ccn_charbuf **clauses; // contents defined in documentation, need utils
00066 };
00067 
00068 #define CCNS_FLAGS_SC 1      // start at current root hash.

00084     struct sync_diff_data *diff_data;

00091 /*
00092  * Utility routines to allocate/deallocate ccns_slice structures
00093  */
00094 struct ccns_slice *
00095 ccns_slice_create() {
00096     struct ccns_slice *s = calloc(1, sizeof(*s));
00097     if (s == NULL)
00098         return(NULL);
00099     s->version = SLICE_VERSION;
00100     s->topo = ccn_charbuf_create_n(8); // name encoding requires minimum 2
00101     s->prefix = ccn_charbuf_create_n(8);
00102     if (s->topo == NULL || s->prefix == NULL) {
00103         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&s->topo);
00104         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&s->prefix);
00105         free(s);
00106         s = NULL;
00107     } else {
00108         ccn_name_init(s->topo);
00109         ccn_name_init(s->prefix);
00110     }
00111     return(s);
00112 }
00113 void
00114 ccns_slice_destroy(struct ccns_slice **sp) {
00115     struct ccns_slice *s = *sp;
00116     if (s != NULL) {
00117         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&(s->topo));
00118         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&(s->prefix));
00119         if (s->clauses != NULL) {
00120             while(s->nclauses > 0) {
00121                 s->nclauses--;
00122                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&(s->clauses[s->nclauses]));
00123             }
00124             free(s->clauses);
00125         }
00126         free(s);
00127         *sp = NULL;
00128     }
00129 }
00130 
00131 /*
00132  * Utility routine to add a clause to a ccns_slice structure
00133  */
00134 int
00135 ccns_slice_add_clause(struct ccns_slice *s, struct ccn_charbuf *c) {
00136     struct ccn_charbuf **clauses = NULL;
00137     struct ccn_charbuf *clause;
00138     clause = ccn_charbuf_create_n(c->length);
00139     if (clause == NULL)
00140         return(-1);
00141     if (s->clauses == NULL) {
00142         s->clauses = calloc(1, sizeof(s->clauses[0]));
00143         if (s->clauses == NULL)
00144             goto Cleanup;
00145     } else {
00146         clauses = realloc(s->clauses, (s->nclauses + 1) * sizeof(s->clauses[0]));
00147         if (clauses == NULL)
00148             goto Cleanup;
00149         s->clauses = clauses;
00150     }
00151     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(clause, c);
00152     s->clauses[s->nclauses++] = clause;
00153     return (0);
00154 
00155 Cleanup:
00156     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&clause);
00157     return (-1);
00158 }
00159 
00160 /*
00161  * Utility routine to set the topo and prefix fields to copies of the
00162  * passed in charbufs
00163  */
00164 int
00165 ccns_slice_set_topo_prefix(struct ccns_slice *s,
00166                            struct ccn_charbuf *t,
00167                            struct ccn_charbuf *p) {
00168     int res = 0;
00169     if (t != NULL) {
00170         ccn_charbuf_reset(s->topo);
00171         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(s->topo, t);
00172     }
00173     if (p != NULL) {
00174         ccn_charbuf_reset(s->prefix);
00175         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(s->prefix, p);
00176     }
00177     return(res);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /*
00181  * utility, may need to be exported, to append the encoding of a
00182  * slice to a charbuf
00183  */
00184 static int
00185 append_slice(struct ccn_charbuf *c, struct ccns_slice *s) {
00186     int res = 0;
00187     int i;
00188 
00189     res |= ccnb_element_begin(c, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSlice);
00190     res |= ccnb_tagged_putf(c, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion, "%u", SLICE_VERSION);
00191     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(c, s->topo);
00192     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(c, s->prefix);
00193     res |= ccnb_element_begin(c, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceList);
00194     for (i = 0; i < s->nclauses ; i++) {
00195         res |= ccnb_tagged_putf(c, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceOp, "%u", 0);
00196         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(c, s->clauses[i]);
00197     }
00198     res |= ccnb_element_end(c);
00199     res |= ccnb_element_end(c);
00200     return (res);
00201 }
00202 /*
00203  * utility, may need to be exported, to parse the buffer into a given slice
00204  * structure.
00205  */
00206 static int
00207 slice_parse(struct ccns_slice *s, const unsigned char *p, size_t size) {
00208     int res = 0;
00209     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00210     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, p, size);
00211     uintmax_t version;
00212     int op;
00213     int start;
00214     struct ccn_charbuf *clause = NULL;
00215 
00216     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSlice))
00217         return (-1);
00218     ccn_buf_advance(d);
00219     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion))
00220         return (-1);
00221     ccn_buf_advance(d);
00222     ccn_parse_uintmax(d, &version);
00223     ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00224     if (version != SLICE_VERSION)
00225         return (-1);
00226     start = d->decoder.token_index;
00227     if (ccn_parse_Name(d, NULL) < 0)
00228         return(-1);
00229     ccn_charbuf_reset(s->topo);
00230     res = ccn_charbuf_append(s->topo, p + start, d->decoder.token_index - start);
00231     if (res < 0)
00232         return(-1);
00233     start = d->decoder.token_index;
00234     if (ccn_parse_Name(d, NULL) < 0)
00235         return(-1);
00236     ccn_charbuf_reset(s->prefix);
00237     res = ccn_charbuf_append(s->prefix, p + start, d->decoder.token_index - start);
00238     if (res < 0)
00239         return(-1);
00240     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceList))
00241         return(-1);
00242     ccn_buf_advance(d);
00243     clause = ccn_charbuf_create();
00244     if (clause == NULL)
00245         return(-1);
00246     while (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceOp)) {
00247         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00248         op = ccn_parse_nonNegativeInteger(d); // op is a small integer
00249         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00250         if (op != 0)
00251             break;
00252         ccn_charbuf_reset(clause);
00253         start = d->decoder.token_index;
00254         if (ccn_parse_Name(d, NULL) < 0)
00255             break;
00256         res = ccn_charbuf_append(clause, p + start, d->decoder.token_index - start);
00257         ccns_slice_add_clause(s, clause);
00258     }
00259     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&clause);
00260     ccn_buf_check_close(d); /* </SyncConfigSliceList> */
00261     ccn_buf_check_close(d); /* </SyncConfigSlice> */
00262     if (d->decoder.index != size || !CCN_FINAL_DSTATE(d->decoder.state))
00263         return(-1);
00264     return(0);
00265 }
00266 /**
00267  * Construct the name of a Sync configuration slice based on the parameters.
00268  * @param nm is the ccn_charbuf which will be set to the ccnb encoded Name
00269  * @param s is the definition of the slice for which the name is required.
00270  * @returns a ccn_charbuf with the ccnb encoded Name of the slice.
00271  */
00272 
00273 int
00274 ccns_slice_name(struct ccn_charbuf *nm, struct ccns_slice *s)
00275 {
00276     struct ccn_charbuf *c;
00277     struct ccn_digest *digest = NULL;
00278     struct ccn_charbuf *hash = NULL;
00279     int res = 0;
00280 
00281     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00282     if (c == NULL)
00283         return (-1);
00284     res = append_slice(c, s);
00285     if (res < 0)
00286         goto Cleanup;
00287 
00288     digest = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_SHA256);
00289     hash = ccn_charbuf_create_n(ccn_digest_size(digest));
00290     if (hash == NULL)
00291         goto Cleanup;
00292     ccn_digest_init(digest);
00293     res |= ccn_digest_update(digest, c->buf, c->length);
00294     res |= ccn_digest_final(digest, hash->buf, hash->limit);
00295     if (res < 0)
00296         goto Cleanup;
00297     hash->length = hash->limit;
00298     if (ccn_name_from_uri(nm, "ccnx:/%C1.M.S.localhost/%C1.S.cs") < 0)
00299         res = -1;
00300     res |= ccn_name_append(nm, hash->buf, hash->length);
00301 
00302 Cleanup:
00303     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00304     ccn_digest_destroy(&digest);
00305     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hash);
00306     return (res);
00307 }
00308 
00309 /**
00310  * Read a slice (from a repository) given the name.
00311  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to read.
00312  * @param name is the charbuf containing the name of the sync slice to be read.
00313  * @param slice is a pointer to a ccns_slice object which will be filled in
00314  *  on successful return.
00315  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00316  */
00317 int
00318 ccns_read_slice(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00319                 struct ccns_slice *slice) {
00320     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pco_space = { 0 };
00321     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco = &pco_space;
00322     struct ccn_charbuf *nc = ccn_charbuf_create_n(name->length);
00323     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00324     const unsigned char *content;
00325     size_t content_length;
00326     int res = -1;
00327 
00328     if (nc == NULL || cob == NULL)
00329         goto Cleanup;
00330 
00331     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(nc, name);
00332     res = ccn_resolve_version(h, nc,  CCN_V_HIGHEST, 100); // XXX: timeout
00333     if (res < 0)
00334         goto Cleanup;
00335     if (res == 0) {
00336         // TODO: check if the last component is a segment number, chop it off, try again.
00337     }
00338     res = ccn_get(h, nc, NULL, 100, cob, pco, NULL, 0);
00339     if (res < 0)
00340         goto Cleanup;
00341     if (pco->type != CCN_CONTENT_DATA) {
00342         res = -1;
00343         goto Cleanup;
00344     }
00345     res = ccn_content_get_value(cob->buf, cob->length, pco,
00346                                 &content, &content_length);
00347     if (res < 0)
00348         goto Cleanup;
00349     res = slice_parse(slice, content, content_length);
00350 
00351 Cleanup:
00352     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nc);
00353     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00354     return (res);
00355 }
00356 
00357 struct ccn_charbuf *
00358 make_scope1_template(void) {
00359     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00360     templ = ccn_charbuf_create_n(16);
00361     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest);
00362     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name);
00363     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Name> */
00364     ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_Scope, "%u", 1);
00365     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Interest> */
00366     return(templ);
00367 }
00368 
00369 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00370 write_interest_handler (struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00371                         enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00372                         struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00373     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = selfp->data;
00374     struct ccn *h = info->h;
00375 
00376     if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST)
00377         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00378     if (ccn_content_matches_interest(cob->buf, cob->length, 1, NULL,
00379                                      info->interest_ccnb,
00380                                      info->pi->offset[CCN_PI_E],
00381                                      info->pi)) {
00382         ccn_put(info->h, cob->buf, cob->length);
00383         selfp->intdata = 1;
00384         ccn_set_run_timeout(h, 0);
00385         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED);
00386     }
00387     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00388 }
00389 
00390 static int
00391 write_slice(struct ccn *h,
00392             struct ccns_slice *slice,
00393             struct ccn_charbuf *name) {
00394     struct ccn_charbuf *content = NULL;
00395     unsigned char *cbuf = NULL;
00396     size_t clength = 0;
00397     struct ccn_charbuf *sw = NULL;
00398     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00399     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = NULL;
00400     struct ccn_signing_params sparm = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00401     struct ccn_closure *wc = NULL;
00402     int res;
00403 
00404     sw = ccn_charbuf_create_n(32 + name->length);
00405     if (sw == NULL) {
00406         res = -1;
00407         goto Cleanup;
00408     }
00409     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(sw, name);
00410     ccn_name_chop(sw, NULL, -1); // remove segment number
00411     ccn_name_from_uri(sw, "%C1.R.sw");
00412     ccn_name_append_nonce(sw);
00413 
00414     // create and sign the content object
00415     cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00416     if (cob == NULL) {
00417         res = -1;
00418         goto Cleanup;
00419     }
00420     if (slice != NULL) {
00421         content = ccn_charbuf_create();
00422         if (content == NULL) {
00423             res = -1;
00424             goto Cleanup;
00425         }
00426         res = append_slice(content, slice);
00427         if (res < 0)
00428             goto Cleanup;
00429         cbuf = content->buf;
00430         clength = content->length;
00431     } else {
00432         sparm.type = CCN_CONTENT_GONE;
00433     }
00434 
00435     sparm.sp_flags = CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00436     res = ccn_sign_content(h, cob, name, &sparm, cbuf, clength);
00437     if (res < 0)
00438         goto Cleanup;
00439     // establish handler for interest in the slice content object
00440     wc = calloc(1, sizeof(*wc));
00441     if (wc == NULL) {
00442         res = -1;
00443         goto Cleanup;
00444     }
00445     wc->p = &write_interest_handler;
00446     wc->data = cob;
00447     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(h, name, wc);
00448     if (res < 0)
00449         goto Cleanup;
00450     templ = make_scope1_template();
00451     if (templ == NULL) {
00452         res = -1;
00453         goto Cleanup;
00454     }
00455     res = ccn_get(h, sw, templ, 1000, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00456     if (res < 0)
00457         goto Cleanup;
00458     ccn_run(h, 1000); // give the repository a chance to fetch the data
00459     if (wc->intdata != 1) {
00460         res = -1;
00461         goto Cleanup;
00462     }
00463     res = 0;
00464 Cleanup:
00465     ccn_set_interest_filter(h, name, NULL);
00466     if (wc != NULL)
00467         free(wc);
00468     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00469     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&content);
00470     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&sw);
00471     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
00472     return (res);
00473 }
00474 
00475 /**
00476  * Write a ccns_slice object to a repository.
00477  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to write.
00478  * @param slice is a pointer to a ccns_slice object to be written.
00479  * @param name, if non-NULL, is a pointer to a charbuf which will be filled
00480  *  in with the name of the slice that was written.
00481  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00482  */
00483 int
00484 ccns_write_slice(struct ccn *h,
00485                  struct ccns_slice *slice,
00486                  struct ccn_charbuf *name) {
00487     struct ccn_charbuf *n = NULL;
00488     int res;
00489     // calculate versioned and segmented name for the slice
00490     n = ccn_charbuf_create();
00491     if (n == NULL)
00492         return(-1);
00493     res = ccns_slice_name(n, slice);
00494     if (res < 0)
00495         goto Cleanup;
00496     res |= ccn_create_version(h, n, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
00497     if (name != NULL) {
00498         ccn_charbuf_reset(name);
00499         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(name, n);
00500     }
00501     res |= ccn_name_append_numeric(n, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, 0);
00502     if (res < 0)
00503         goto Cleanup;
00504     res = write_slice(h, slice, n);
00505 
00506 Cleanup:
00507     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&n);
00508     return (res);
00509 }
00510 /**
00511  * Delete a ccns_slice object from a repository.
00512  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to write.
00513  * @param name is a pointer to a charbuf naming the slice to be deleted.
00514  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00515  */
00516 int
00517 ccns_delete_slice(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *name) {
00518     struct ccn_charbuf *n = NULL;
00519     int res = 0;
00520 
00521     // calculate versioned and segmented name for the slice
00522     n = ccn_charbuf_create_n(32 + name->length);
00523     if (n == NULL)
00524         return(-1);
00525     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(n, name);
00526     res |= ccn_create_version(h, n, CCN_V_NOW | CCN_V_REPLACE, 0, 0);
00527     res |= ccn_name_append_numeric(n, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, 0);
00528     if (res >= 0)
00529         res = write_slice(h, NULL, n);
00530     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&n);
00531     return (res);
00532 }
00533 
00534 /*
00535  * local time source for event schedule
00536  */
00537 static void
00538 gettime(const struct ccn_gettime *self, struct ccn_timeval *result) {
00539     struct timeval now = {0};
00540     gettimeofday(&now, 0);
00541     result->s = now.tv_sec;
00542     result->micros = now.tv_usec;
00543 }

00568 // noteErr2 is used to deliver error messages when there is no
00569 // active root or base
00570 
00571 static int
00572 noteErr2(const char *why, const char *msg) {
00573     fprintf(stderr, "** ERROR: %s, %s\n", why, msg);
00574     fflush(stderr);
00575     return -1;
00576 }

00578 static void
00579 my_r_sync_msg(struct sync_plumbing *sd, const char *fmt, ...) {
00580     va_list ap;
00581     va_start(ap, fmt);
00582     vfprintf(stdout, fmt, ap);
00583     va_end(ap);
00584     fprintf(stdout, "\n");
00585     fflush(stdout);
00586 }
00587 
00588 // extractNode parses and creates a sync tree node from an upcall info
00589 // returns NULL if there was any kind of error
00590 static struct SyncNodeComposite *
00591 extractNode(struct SyncRootStruct *root, struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00592     // first, find the content
00593     char *here = "sync_track.extractNode";
00594     const unsigned char *cp = NULL;
00595     size_t cs = 0;
00596     size_t ccnb_size = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E];
00597     const unsigned char *ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00598     int res = ccn_content_get_value(ccnb, ccnb_size, info->pco,
00599                                     &cp, &cs);
00600     if (res < 0 || cs < DEFAULT_HASH_BYTES) {
00601         SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "ccn_content_get_value", __LINE__);
00602         return NULL;
00603     }
00604     
00605     // second, parse the object
00606     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = SyncAllocComposite(root->base);
00607     struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00608     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&ds, cp, cs);
00609     res |= SyncParseComposite(nc, d);
00610     if (res < 0) {
00611         // failed, so back out of the allocations
00612         SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "bad parse", -res);
00613         SyncFreeComposite(nc);
00614         nc = NULL;
00615     }
00616     return nc;
00617 }
00618 
00619 /* UNUSED */ struct sync_diff_fetch_data *
00620 check_fetch_data(struct ccns_handle *ch, struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd) {
00621     struct sync_diff_fetch_data *each = ch->fetch_data;
00622     while (each != NULL) {
00623         struct sync_diff_fetch_data *next = each->next;
00624         if (each == fd) return fd;
00625         each = next;
00626     }
00627     return NULL;
00628 }
00629 
00630 static struct sync_diff_fetch_data *
00631 find_fetch_data(struct ccns_handle *ch, struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce) {
00632     struct sync_diff_fetch_data *each = ch->fetch_data;
00633     while (each != NULL) {
00634         struct sync_diff_fetch_data *next = each->next;
00635         if (each->hash_cache_entry == ce) return each;
00636         each = next;
00637     }
00638     return NULL;
00639 }
00640 
00641 static int
00642 delink_fetch_data(struct ccns_handle *ch, struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd) {
00643     if (fd != NULL) {
00644         struct sync_diff_fetch_data *each = ch->fetch_data;
00645         struct sync_diff_fetch_data *lag = NULL;
00646         while (each != NULL) {
00647             struct sync_diff_fetch_data *next = each->next;
00648             if (each == fd) {
00649                 if (lag == NULL) ch->fetch_data = next;
00650                 else lag->next = next;
00651                 return 1;
00652             }
00653             lag = each;
00654             each = next;
00655         }
00656     }
00657     return 0;
00658 }
00659 
00660 static void
00661 free_fetch_data(struct ccns_handle *ch, struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd) {
00662     if (delink_fetch_data(ch, fd)) {
00663         struct ccn_closure *action = fd->action;
00664         if (action != NULL && action->data == fd)
00665             // break the link here
00666             action->data = NULL;
00667         fd->action = NULL;
00668         // only free the data if it is ours
00669         free(fd);
00670     }
00671 }
00672 
00673 static void
00674 setCurrentHash(struct SyncRootStruct *root, struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce) {
00675     struct ccn_charbuf *hash = root->currentHash;
00676     hash->length = 0;
00677     if (ce != NULL)
00678         ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(hash, ce->hash);
00679 }
00680 
00681 static struct SyncHashCacheEntry *
00682 chooseNextHash(struct ccns_handle *ch) {
00683     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *nce = ch->next_ce;
00684     if (nce != NULL && (nce->state & SyncHashState_covered) == 0
00685         && find_fetch_data(ch, nce) == NULL)
00686         return nce;
00687     struct SyncHashInfoList *each = ch->hashSeen;
00688     while (each != NULL) {
00689         struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = each->ce;
00690         if (ce != NULL && (ce->state & SyncHashState_covered) == 0
00691             && (nce == NULL || SyncCompareHash(ce->hash, nce->hash) > 0)
00692             && find_fetch_data(ch, ce) == NULL)
00693             return ce;
00694         each = each->next;
00695     }
00696     return NULL;
00697 }
00698 
00699 // each_round starts a new comparison or update round,
00700 // provided that the attached sync_diff is not busy
00701 // we reuse the sync_diff_data, but reset the comparison hashes
00702 // if we can't start one, we wait and try again
00703 static int
00704 each_round(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
00705            void *clienth,
00706            struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
00707            int flags) {
00708     if (ev == NULL)
00709         // not valid
00710         return -1;
00711     struct ccns_handle *ch = ev->evdata;
00712     if (flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL || ch == NULL) {
00713         return -1;
00714     }
00715     if (ch->needUpdate) {
00716         // do an update
00717         switch (ch->update_data->state) {
00718             case sync_update_state_init:
00719             case sync_update_state_error:
00720             case sync_update_state_done: {
00721                 if (ch->namesToAdd != NULL && ch->namesToAdd->len > 0) {
00722                     sync_update_start(ch->update_data, ch->namesToAdd);
00723                 } else {
00724                     // update not very useful
00725                     ch->needUpdate = 0;
00726                     return 1000;
00727                 }
00728             }
00729             default:
00730                 // we are busy right now
00731                 break;
00732         }
00733     } else {
00734         // do a comparison
00735         struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = ch->diff_data;
00736         switch (diff_data->state) {
00737             case sync_diff_state_init:
00738             case sync_diff_state_error:
00739             case sync_diff_state_done: {
00740                 // there is no comparison active
00741                 struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = ch->next_ce;
00742                 if (ce != NULL
00743                     && ((ce->state & SyncHashState_covered) != 0))
00744                     ce = chooseNextHash(ch);
00745                 if (ce != NULL
00746                     && ((ce->state & SyncHashState_covered) == 0)
00747                     && ce != ch->last_ce) {
00748                     // worth trying
00749                     ch->next_ce = ce;
00750                     if (ch->last_ce != NULL)
00751                         diff_data->hashX = ch->last_ce->hash;
00752                     if (ch->next_ce != NULL)
00753                         diff_data->hashY = ch->next_ce->hash;
00754                     sync_diff_start(diff_data);
00755                 }
00756             }
00757             default:
00758                 // we are busy right now
00759                 break;
00760         }
00761     }
00762     return 500000; // 0.5 seconds
00763 }
00764 
00765 // start_round schedules a new comparison round,
00766 // cancelling any previously scheduled round
00767 static void
00768 start_round(struct ccns_handle *ch, int micros) {
00769     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev = ch->ev;
00770     if (ev != NULL && ev->action != NULL && ev->evdata == ch)
00771         // get rid of the existing event
00772         ccn_schedule_cancel(ch->sync_plumbing->sched, ev);
00773     // start a new event
00774     ch->ev = ccn_schedule_event(ch->sync_plumbing->sched,
00775                                 micros,
00776                                 each_round,
00777                                 ch,
00778                                 0);
00779     return;
00780 }
00781 
00782 // my_response is used to handle a reply
00783 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00784 my_response(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00785             enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00786             struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00787     static char *here = "sync_track.my_response";
00788     enum ccn_upcall_res ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
00789     switch (kind) {
00790         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00791             free(selfp);
00792             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00793             break;
00794         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED:
00795             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY;
00796             break;
00797         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING:
00798             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_FETCHKEY;
00799             break;
00800         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT: {
00801             struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd = selfp->data;
00802             //enum local_flags flags = selfp->intdata;
00803             if (fd == NULL) break;
00804             struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = fd->diff_data;
00805             if (diff_data == NULL) break;
00806             struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
00807             free_fetch_data(ch, fd);
00808             start_round(ch, 10);
00809             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00810             break;
00811         }
00812         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW:
00813         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT: {
00814             struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd = selfp->data;
00815             enum local_flags flags = selfp->intdata;
00816             if (fd == NULL) break;
00817             struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = fd->diff_data;
00818             if (diff_data == NULL) break;
00819             struct SyncRootStruct *root = diff_data->root;
00820             if (root == NULL) break;
00821             struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
00822             struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = extractNode(root, info);
00823             if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE) {
00824                 char fs[1024];
00825                 int pos = 0;
00826                 switch (flags) {
00827                     case LF_NULL: 
00828                         pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, "null");
00829                         break;
00830                     case LF_ADVISE:
00831                         pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, "advise");
00832                         break;
00833                     case LF_NODE:
00834                         pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, "node");
00835                         break;
00836                     default: 
00837                         pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, "??%d", flags);
00838                         break;
00839                 }
00840                 if (nc != NULL)
00841                     pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, ", nc OK");
00842                 struct ccn_charbuf *nm = SyncNameForIndexbuf(info->content_ccnb,
00843                                                              info->content_comps);
00844                 struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
00845                 pos += snprintf(fs+pos, sizeof(fs)-pos, ", %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00846                 SyncNoteSimple(diff_data->root, here, fs);
00847                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
00848                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00849             }
00850             if (nc != NULL) {
00851                 // the node exists, so store it
00852                 // TBD: check the hash?
00853                 struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
00854                 struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = SyncHashEnter(root->ch,
00855                                                               nc->hash->buf, nc->hash->length,
00856                                                               SyncHashState_remote);
00857                 if (flags == LF_ADVISE) {
00858                     ch->hashSeen = SyncNoteHash(ch->hashSeen, ce);
00859                     if (ch->next_ce == NULL)
00860                         // have to have an initial place to start
00861                         ch->next_ce = ce;
00862                 }
00863                 if (ce->ncR == NULL) {
00864                     // store the node
00865                     ce->ncR = nc;
00866                     SyncNodeIncRC(nc);
00867                 } else {
00868                     // flush the node
00869                     SyncNodeDecRC(nc);
00870                     nc = NULL;
00871                 }
00872                 if (flags != LF_NULL) {
00873                     // from start_interest
00874                     start_round(ch, 10);
00875                 } else {
00876                     // from sync_diff
00877                     sync_diff_note_node(diff_data, ce);
00878                 }
00879                 ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00880             }
00881             free_fetch_data(ch, fd);
00882             break;
00883         default:
00884             // SHOULD NOT HAPPEN
00885             break;
00886         }
00887     }
00888     return ret;
00889 }
00890 
00891 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00892 advise_interest_arrived(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00893                         enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00894                         struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00895     // the reason to have a listener is to be able to listen for changes
00896     // in the collection without relying on the replies to our root advise
00897     // interests, which may not receive timely replies (althoug they eventually
00898     // get replies)
00899     static char *here = "sync_track.advise_interest_arrived";
00900     enum ccn_upcall_res ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
00901     switch (kind) {
00902         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00903             free(selfp);
00904             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00905             break;
00906         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST: {
00907             struct ccns_handle *ch = selfp->data;
00908             if (ch == NULL) {
00909                 // this got cancelled
00910                 ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00911                 break;
00912             }
00913             struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = ch->diff_data;
00914             struct SyncRootStruct *root = ch->root;
00915             //struct SyncBaseStruct *base = root->base;
00916             int skipToHash = SyncComponentCount(diff_data->root->topoPrefix) + 2;
00917             // skipToHash gets to the new hash
00918             // topo + marker + sliceHash
00919             const unsigned char *hp = NULL;
00920             size_t hs = 0;
00921             if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE) {
00922                 struct ccn_charbuf *name = SyncNameForIndexbuf(info->interest_ccnb,
00923                                                                info->interest_comps);
00924                 SyncNoteUri(root, here, "entered", name);
00925                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00926             }
00927             int cres = ccn_name_comp_get(info->interest_ccnb, info->interest_comps, skipToHash, &hp, &hs);
00928             if (cres < 0) {
00929                 if (ch->debug >= CCNL_INFO)
00930                     SyncNoteSimple(diff_data->root, here, "wrong number of interest name components");
00931                 break;
00932             }
00933             struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = SyncHashEnter(root->ch, hp, hs,
00934                                                           SyncHashState_remote);
00935             if (ce == NULL || ce->state & SyncHashState_covered) {
00936                 // should not be added
00937                 if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE)
00938                     SyncNoteSimple(diff_data->root, here, "skipped");
00939             } else {
00940                 // remember the remote hash, maybe start something
00941                 if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE)
00942                     SyncNoteSimple(diff_data->root, here, "noting");
00943                 ch->hashSeen = SyncNoteHash(ch->hashSeen, ce);
00944                 start_interest(diff_data);
00945             }
00946             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00947             break;
00948         }
00949         default:
00950             // SHOULD NOT HAPPEN
00951             break;
00952     }
00953     return ret;
00954 }
00955 
00956 static int
00957 start_interest(struct sync_diff_data *diff_data) {
00958     static char *here = "sync_track.start_interest";
00959     struct SyncRootStruct *root = diff_data->root;
00960     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = root->base;
00961     struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
00962     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = ch->next_ce;
00963     struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = SyncCopyName(diff_data->root->topoPrefix);
00964     int res = 0;
00965     struct ccn *ccn = base->sd->ccn;
00966     if (ccn == NULL)
00967         return SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "bad ccn handle", __LINE__);
00968     res |= ccn_name_append_str(prefix, "\xC1.S.ra");
00969     res |= ccn_name_append(prefix, root->sliceHash->buf, root->sliceHash->length);
00970     if (ce != NULL) {
00971         // append the best component seen
00972         res |= ccn_name_append(prefix, ce->hash->buf, ce->hash->length);
00973     } else {
00974         // append an empty component
00975         res |= ccn_name_append(prefix, "", 0);
00976     }
00977     struct SyncNameAccum *excl = SyncExclusionsFromHashList(root, NULL, ch->hashSeen);
00978     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
00979                                                    base->priv->syncScope,
00980                                                    base->priv->fetchLifetime,
00981                                                    -1, -1, excl);
00982     SyncFreeNameAccumAndNames(excl);
00983     struct ccn_closure *action = calloc(1, sizeof(*action));
00984     struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fetch_data = calloc(1, sizeof(*fetch_data));
00985     fetch_data->diff_data = diff_data;
00986     fetch_data->action = action;
00987     fetch_data->startTime = SyncCurrentTime();
00988     // note: no ce available yet
00989     action->data = fetch_data;
00990     action->intdata = LF_ADVISE;
00991     action->p = &my_response;
00992     fetch_data->next = ch->fetch_data;
00993     ch->fetch_data = fetch_data;
00994     res |= ccn_express_interest(ccn, prefix, action, template);
00995     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
00996     if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE) {
00997         SyncNoteUri(diff_data->root, here, "start_interest", prefix);
00998     }
00999     if (res < 0) {
01000         SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "ccn_express_interest failed", __LINE__);
01001         // return the resources, must free fd first!
01002         free_fetch_data(ch, fetch_data);
01003         free(action);
01004         return -1;
01005     }
01006     return 1;
01007 }
01008 
01009 static int
01010 my_get(struct sync_diff_get_closure *gc,
01011        struct sync_diff_fetch_data *fd) {
01012     char *here = "sync_track.my_get";
01013     struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = gc->diff_data;
01014     struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
01015     struct SyncRootStruct *root = diff_data->root;
01016     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = root->base;
01017     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = fd->hash_cache_entry;
01018     int res = 0;
01019     struct ccn *ccn = base->sd->ccn;
01020     if (ccn == NULL)
01021         return SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "bad ccn handle", __LINE__);
01022     if (ce == NULL)
01023         return SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "bad cache entry", __LINE__);
01024     // first, check for existing fetch of same hash
01025     struct ccn_charbuf *hash = ce->hash;
01026     struct ccn_charbuf *name = SyncCopyName(diff_data->root->topoPrefix);
01027     ccn_name_append_str(name, "\xC1.S.nf");
01028     res |= ccn_name_append(name, root->sliceHash->buf, root->sliceHash->length);
01029     if (hash == NULL || hash->length == 0)
01030         res |= ccn_name_append(name, "", 0);
01031     else
01032         res |= ccn_name_append(name, ce->hash->buf, ce->hash->length);
01033     if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE) {
01034         SyncNoteUri(diff_data->root, here, "starting", name);
01035     }
01036     // note, this fd belongs to sync_diff, not us
01037     struct ccn_closure *action = calloc(1, sizeof(*action));
01038     action->data = fd;
01039     action->p = &my_response;
01040     fd->action = action;
01041     
01042     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01043                                                    root->priv->syncScope,
01044                                                    base->priv->fetchLifetime,
01045                                                    -1, 1, NULL);
01046     
01047     res = ccn_express_interest(ccn, name, action, template);
01048     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01049     if (res < 0) {
01050         SyncNoteFailed(root, here, "ccn_express_interest failed", __LINE__);
01051         free(action);
01052         return -1;
01053     }
01054     return 1;
01055 }
01056 
01057 // my_add is called when sync_diff discovers a new name
01058 // right now all we do is log it
01059 static int
01060 my_add(struct sync_diff_add_closure *ac, struct ccn_charbuf *name) {
01061     char *here = "sync_track.my_add";
01062     struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = ac->diff_data;
01063     struct ccns_handle *ch = diff_data->client_data;
01064     if (name == NULL) {
01065         // end of comparison, so fire off another round
01066         struct SyncRootStruct *root = diff_data->root;
01067         // struct ccn_charbuf *hash = ch->next_ce->hash;
01068         struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = ch->next_ce;
01069         int delay = 1000000;
01070         if (ch->debug >= CCNL_INFO) {
01071             char temp[1024];
01072             int pos = 0;
01073             ch->add_accum += diff_data->namesAdded;
01074             pos += snprintf(temp+pos, sizeof(temp)-pos, "added %jd, accum %jd",
01075                             (intmax_t) diff_data->namesAdded, (intmax_t) ch->add_accum);
01076             SyncNoteSimple(diff_data->root, here, temp);
01077         }
01078         if (diff_data->state == sync_diff_state_done) {
01079             // successful difference, so next_ce is covered
01080             ce->state |= SyncHashState_covered;
01081             delay = 10000;
01082             if (ch->last_ce == NULL) {
01083                 // first time through, just accept the new entry
01084                 ch->last_ce = ce;
01085                 setCurrentHash(root, ce);
01086                 ch->update_data->ceStart = ce;
01087             } else if (ch->namesToAdd != NULL && ch->namesToAdd->len > 0) {
01088                 // need to update the entry
01089                 ch->needUpdate = 1;
01090                 ch->last_ce = ce;
01091                 ch->update_data->ceStart = ce;
01092                 delay = 1000;
01093             } else {
01094                 // the last guess was not so good for the max, so revert
01095                 ce = ch->last_ce;
01096                 ch->next_ce = ce;
01097             }
01098         }
01099         start_round(ch, delay);
01100     } else {
01101         // accumulate the names
01102         if (ch->namesToAdd == NULL) {
01103             ch->namesToAdd = SyncAllocNameAccum(4);
01104         }
01105         SyncNameAccumAppend(ch->namesToAdd, SyncCopyName(name), 0);
01106         if (ch->debug >= CCNL_INFO)
01107             SyncNoteUri(diff_data->root, here, "adding", name);
01108         if (ch->nc != NULL) {
01109             // callback per name
01110             struct ccn_charbuf *lhash = ((ch->last_ce != NULL)
01111                                          ? ch->last_ce->hash : NULL);
01112             struct ccn_charbuf *rhash = ((ch->next_ce != NULL)
01113                                          ? ch->next_ce->hash : NULL);
01114             int res = ch->nc->callback(ch->nc, lhash, rhash, name);
01115             if (res < 0) {
01116                 // stop the comparison here
01117                 // TBD: anything else to do?
01118                 return -1;
01119             }
01120         }
01121     }
01122     return 0;
01123 }
01124 
01125 static int
01126 note_update_done(struct sync_done_closure *dc) {
01127     struct ccns_handle *ch = dc->data;
01128     struct sync_update_data *ud = dc->update_data;
01129     if (ch != NULL && ch->update_data == ud && ud != NULL && ud->done_closure == dc) {
01130         // passes sanity check
01131         static char *here = "sync_track.note_update_done";
01132         if (ud->ceStop != ud->ceStart && ud->ceStop != NULL) {
01133             // we have a new hash that is better
01134             setCurrentHash(ud->root, ud->ceStop);
01135             ud->ceStart = ud->ceStop;
01136             if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE)
01137                 SyncNoteSimple(ud->root, here, "new hash set");
01138         } else {
01139             if (ch->debug >= CCNL_FINE)
01140                 SyncNoteSimple(ud->root, here, "no new hash");
01141         }
01142         ch->needUpdate = 0;
01143         return 1;
01144     }
01145     return -1;
01146 }
01147 
01148 // the only client routine we might need is the logger
01149 // there is no Repo in this application
01150 static struct sync_plumbing_client_methods client_methods = {
01151     my_r_sync_msg, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
01152 };
01153 
01154 struct ccns_handle *
01155 ccns_open(struct ccn *h,
01156           struct ccns_slice *slice,
01157           struct ccns_name_closure *nc,
01158           struct ccn_charbuf *rhash,
01159           struct ccn_charbuf *pname) {
01160     struct ccns_handle *ch = calloc(1, sizeof(*ch));
01161     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = NULL;
01162     struct SyncRootStruct *root = NULL;
01163     struct sync_plumbing *sync_plumbing = NULL;
01164 
01165     if (nc == NULL || nc->callback == NULL) return NULL;
01166     
01167     sync_plumbing = calloc(1, sizeof(*sync_plumbing));
01168     sync_plumbing->client_methods = &client_methods;
01169     sync_plumbing->ccn = h;
01170     sync_plumbing->sched = ccn_get_schedule(h);
01171     if (sync_plumbing->sched == NULL) {
01172         struct ccn_schedule *schedule;
01173         struct ccn_gettime *timer = calloc(1, sizeof(*timer));
01174         timer->descr[0]='S';
01175         timer->micros_per_base = 1000000;
01176         timer->gettime = &gettime;
01177         timer->data = h;
01178         schedule = ccn_schedule_create(h, timer);
01179         ccn_set_schedule(h, schedule);
01180         sync_plumbing->sched = schedule;
01181     }
01182     ch->sync_plumbing = sync_plumbing;
01183     ch->nc = nc;
01184     nc->ccns = ch;
01185     ch->ccn = h;
01186     
01187     // gen the closure for diff data
01188     struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = calloc(1, sizeof(*diff_data));
01189     struct sync_diff_get_closure *get_closure = calloc(1, sizeof(*get_closure));
01190     struct sync_diff_add_closure *add_closure = calloc(1, sizeof(*add_closure));
01191     diff_data->add_closure = add_closure;
01192     add_closure->diff_data = diff_data;
01193     add_closure->add = my_add;
01194     add_closure->data = ch;
01195     diff_data->get_closure = get_closure;
01196     get_closure->diff_data = diff_data;
01197     get_closure->get = my_get;
01198     get_closure->data = ch;
01199     
01200     diff_data->hashX = NULL;
01201     diff_data->hashY = NULL;
01202     diff_data->client_data = ch;
01203     ch->diff_data = diff_data;
01204     
01205     // gen the closure for update data
01206     struct sync_done_closure *done_closure = calloc(1, sizeof(*done_closure));
01207     struct sync_update_data *update_data = calloc(1, sizeof(*update_data));
01208     update_data->done_closure = done_closure;
01209     update_data->done_closure->done = note_update_done;
01210     update_data->done_closure->update_data = update_data;
01211     update_data->done_closure->data = ch;
01212     update_data->client_data = ch;
01213     ch->update_data = update_data;
01214     
01215     base = SyncNewBase(sync_plumbing);
01216     ch->base = base;
01217     struct sync_plumbing_sync_methods *sync_methods = ch->sync_plumbing->sync_methods;
01218     if (sync_methods!= NULL && sync_methods->sync_start != NULL) {
01219         // read the initial options, start life for the base
01220         sync_methods->sync_start(ch->sync_plumbing, NULL); 
01221     }
01222     
01223     // make the debug levels agree
01224     int debug = base->debug; // TBD: how to let client set this?
01225     if (debug < CCNL_WARNING) debug = CCNL_WARNING;
01226     base->debug = debug;
01227     ch->debug = debug;
01228     root = SyncAddRoot(base, base->priv->syncScope,
01229                        slice->topo, slice->prefix, NULL);
01230     ch->root = root;
01231     diff_data->root = root;
01232     update_data->root = root;
01233     
01234     // register the root advise interest listener
01235     struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = SyncCopyName(diff_data->root->topoPrefix);
01236     ccn_name_append_str(prefix, "\xC1.S.ra");
01237     ccn_name_append(prefix, root->sliceHash->buf, root->sliceHash->length);
01238     struct ccn_closure *action = NEW_STRUCT(1, ccn_closure);
01239     action->data = ch;
01240     action->p = &advise_interest_arrived;
01241     ch->registered = action;
01242     int res = ccn_set_interest_filter(h, prefix, action);
01243     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefix);
01244     if (res < 0) {
01245         noteErr2("ccns_open", "registration failed");
01246         ccns_close(&ch, rhash, pname);
01247         ch = NULL;
01248     } else {
01249         // start the very first round
01250         start_round(ch, 10);
01251     }
01252     return ch;
01253 }
01254 
01255 void
01256 ccns_close(struct ccns_handle **sh,
01257            struct ccn_charbuf *rhash,
01258            struct ccn_charbuf *pname) {
01259     // Use this to shut down a ccns_handle and return the resources
01260     // This should work any legal state!
01261     // TBD: fill in pname argument
01262     if (sh != NULL) {
01263         struct ccns_handle *ch = *sh;
01264         *sh = NULL;
01265         if (ch != NULL) {
01266             struct SyncRootStruct *root = ch->root;
01267             
01268             struct ccn_closure *registered = ch->registered;
01269             if (registered != NULL) {
01270                 // break the link, remove this particular registration
01271                 registered->data = NULL;
01272                 ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags(ch->sync_plumbing->ccn,
01273                                                    root->topoPrefix,
01274                                                    registered,
01275                                                    0);
01276             }
01277             // cancel my looping event
01278             struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev = ch->ev;
01279             if (ev != NULL) {
01280                 ch->ev = NULL;
01281                 ev->evdata = NULL;
01282                 ccn_schedule_cancel(ch->sync_plumbing->sched, ev);
01283             }
01284             // stop any differencing
01285             struct sync_diff_data *diff_data = ch->diff_data;
01286             if (diff_data != NULL) {
01287                 // no more differencing
01288                 ch->diff_data = NULL;
01289                 free(diff_data->add_closure);
01290                 diff_data->add_closure = NULL;
01291                 free(diff_data->get_closure);
01292                 diff_data->get_closure = NULL;
01293                 sync_diff_stop(diff_data);
01294             }
01295             // stop any updating
01296             struct sync_update_data *ud = ch->update_data;
01297             if (ud != NULL) {
01298                 ch->update_data = NULL;
01299                 free(ud->done_closure);
01300                 ud->done_closure = NULL;
01301                 sync_update_stop(ud);
01302             }
01303             // stop any fetching
01304             while (ch->fetch_data != NULL) {
01305                 free_fetch_data(ch, ch->fetch_data);
01306             }
01307             
01308             if (rhash != NULL) {
01309                 // save the current root hash
01310                 rhash->length = 0;
01311                 if (root->currentHash != NULL)
01312                     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(rhash, root->currentHash);
01313             }
01314             
01315             // get rid of the root
01316             ch->root = NULL;
01317             SyncRemRoot(root);
01318 
01319             // get rid of the base
01320             if (ch->base != NULL) {
01321                 struct sync_plumbing_sync_methods *sm = ch->sync_plumbing->sync_methods;
01322                 ch->base = NULL;
01323                 if (sm != NULL && sm->sync_stop != NULL) {
01324                     sm->sync_stop(ch->sync_plumbing, NULL); 
01325                 }
01326             }
01327 
01328             free(ch);
01329             
01330         }
01331     }
01332 }
